awd_titl_txt: Contrasts in Styles of Cretaceous Deformation, Northwestern Mexico
awd_abstract_narration: Contrasting styles of deformation to some degree are commonly              exhibited along strike in orogens despite being developed in                    basically the same tectonic setting.  This proposal will                        investigate a particularly abrupt change in Cretaceous deformation              style along the western cratonic margin in Sonora, Mexico that is               represented by the ductilly deformed crystalline rocks in                       northwestern Sonora and gravity-driven low-temperature slide masses             in eastern Sonora.  Deformation in both areas is the consequence                of Cretaceous convergence, and this study is expected to illuminate             the response of the crust to the tectonism.  Results may guide                  research in similar orogens showing along-strike changes in                     tectonic style.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH - OF THE COMMONWEALTH SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION
